block.p: Eva Abigail Temkin and David Mark Lehn Jr., both litigation associates at law firms, were married on Friday at the United States Federal Courthouse in Brooklyn. The officiant was Judge John Gleeson of the United States District Court for the Eastern District of New York.

The couple met at New York University, from which they received their law degrees, he magna cum laude. The bride, 31, is with Cravath, Swaine & Moore in New York, and the bridegroom, also 31, is at Cooper & Kirk in Washington.

Eva Abigail Temkin and David Mark Lehn Jr., both litigation associates at law firms, were married on Friday at the United States Federal Courthouse in Brooklyn. The officiant was Judge John Gleeson of the United States District Court for the Eastern District of New York.

Eva Abigail Temkin and David Mark Lehn Jr., both litigation associates at law firms, were married on Friday at the United States Federal Courthouse in Brooklyn. The officiant was Judge John Gleeson of the United States District Court for the Eastern District of New York.

The couple met at New York University, from which they received their law degrees, he magna cum laude. The bride, 31, is with Cravath, Swaine & Moore in New York, and the bridegroom, also 31, is at Cooper & Kirk in Washington.

Ms. Temkin is keeping her name. She graduated cum laude from the University of Michigan. She is a daughter of Bharti Temkin and Henryk Temkin of Arlington, Va., both professors, now on sabbaticals, at Texas Tech University in Lubbock, Tex.

Her father holds the Jack Maddox chair and is the Horn professor of electrical engineering there. He is now working as a program manager for the United States Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency in Arlington. Her mother is a professor of computer science.

Mr. Lehn will begin a clerkship in August for Douglas H. Ginsburg, the chief judge for the United States Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia Circuit. The bridegroom graduated cum laude from Harvard.

He is a son of Barbara J. Lehn and David M. Lehn, both of Fairfield, Conn. His father is a partner at the law firm of Withers Bergman in New Haven. His mother is the owner of Barbara Barbara, a gift shop in Fairfield.
